item.title: Report E-2024070042
item.description:
Report E-2024070042

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was offloading a pallet from a trailer at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Menomonee Falls, WI when they noticed a spill of material upon moving a pallet. The bags on the pallet were poorly shrink wrapped, allowing for the material to shift due to vibrations while in transit resulting in tears to the bags. One bag released contents estimated to be in a quantity of approximately 10 lbs of hazardous waste. No injuries or chemical exposures were reported. The bags were overpacked for continued transportation to the disposal facility.

item.title: Report X-2024070059
item.description:
Report X-2024070059

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 28th a package with no indication of Dg marked on the outside was emitting a paint like odor. After opening the package a 1 gallon sized can was found inside of a bag and the can was marked as a class 3 and stated Resin on it. There was some spillage of liquid inside of the bag. The package was placed into a salvage drum and is being held pending further disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024060670
item.description:
Report E-2024060670

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A leaking container of hydrogen peroxide and peroxyacetic acid was discovered at the Menomonee Falls 10-Day Dock while unloading a trailer at the 10 day intransit facility in Menomonee Falls, WI. The cardboard container was saturated with the liquid, and needed to be repackaged, as well as handled appropriately by a reactives trained Menomonee Falls Field Service employee. An investigation revealed the source of the spill was due to the closure not being secured on the inner package allowing for material to leak out of the top.
